DOC.brief_summary: The study compare short- long-term risk 24-day regimen drospirenone-containing oral contraceptive risk establish oral contraceptive study population representative actual user individual preparation .
DOC.brief_title: International Active Surveillance Study Women Taking Oral Contraceptives ( INAS-OC )
DOC.detailed_description: Drospirenone novel progestogen antiandrogenic antimineralocorticoid property . A large active post-marketing surveillance study demonstrate 21-day regimen 3mg drospirenone 30mcg ethinylestradiol use safely oral contraception . This study investigate risk short long-term use 24-day regimen drospirenone/ethinylestradiol comparison establish OCs study population representative actual user individual preparation . INAS-OC prospective , control , non-interventional cohort study two study arm : OCs contain drospirenone OCs contain progestogen . The study start USA April 2005 extend several European country September 2008 base launch status 24-day regimen . New user OC ( starter , switcher without pill intake break recurrent user pill intake break [ different OC ] ) accrue network prescribe physician . Baseline follow-up information collect via self-administered questionnaire . Data analysis base life-table method compare cohort . All analysis make allowance confounding , use method include multivariate technique Cox regression .
DOC.criteria: Firstever OC user ( `` starter '' ) Women switch OC use without pill intake break ( `` switcher '' ) Recurrent user pill intake break ( `` recurrent user '' ) Women willing participate active surveillance Women agree participate Longterm user
